Body:
I naively picked up a book in which the author assumes that the reader has a background in linguistics, so she often uses abbreviations without first explaining what they mean. I don't have such a background, but before I give up on this book I am hoping I can begin to get it with your help.

How does one read the following example?

...the Branching Direction Parameter is a parameter defined in terms of the direction of the complementizer phrase (CP) head as in Example 3. A left C0 head as in Example 3a is correlated with right branching, and a right C0 head as in Example 3b is correcelated with left branching.

3a. C' > [C0 [IP]]
3b. C' > [[IP] C0]

Again, she doesn't mention what C', >, C0, IP or the brackets represent.
Title: How are these diagrams read?
